```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```
#Data loading
```{r}
data <- read_tsv(file = "data/03_my_data_clean_aug.tsv",show_col_types = FALSE)
```

#Data preprocessing for PCA
```{r}
PCA_data <- data %>% 
  select(where(is.numeric),
        -(matches("energy|Log|eff|PC|time.sec|power")))

as_tibble(PCA_data)
```

#PCA
```{r}
pca_fit <- PCA_data %>% 
  prcomp(scale = TRUE)
```

#PC1 VS PC2 Plot - Population
```{r}
pl1 <- pca_fit %>%
  augment(data) %>% # add original dataset back in
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, .fittedPC2, color = Population)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5)

pl2 <- pca_fit %>%
  augment(data) %>% # add original dataset back in
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, .fittedPC2, color = Sex)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5)
  
show(pl1 / pl2)
```
#Eigenvalues percentage
```{r}
pca_fit %>%
  tidy(matrix = "eigenvalues")
```

#Eigenvalues percentage plot
```{r}
pca_fit %>%
  tidy(matrix = "eigenvalues") %>%
  ggplot(aes(PC, percent)) +
  geom_col(fill = "#56B4E9", alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:9) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    labels = scales::percent_format(),
    expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.01))
  ) 
```

#Rotation matrix
```{r}
pca_fit %>%
  tidy(matrix = "rotation")
```

#Plot rotation matrix(arrows)
```{r}
# define arrow style for plotting
arrow_style <- arrow(
  angle = 20, ends = "first", type = "closed", length = grid::unit(8, "pt")
)

# plot rotation matrix
pca_fit %>%
  tidy(matrix = "rotation") %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = "PC", names_prefix = "PC", values_from = "value") %>%
  ggplot(aes(PC1, PC2)) +
  geom_segment(xend = 0, yend = 0, arrow = arrow_style) +
  geom_text(
    aes(label = column),
    hjust = 1, nudge_x = -0.02, 
    color = "#904C2F"
  ) +
  xlim(-1.25, .5) + ylim(-.5, 1) +
  coord_fixed()  # fix aspect ratio to 1:1
 
```



##one hot encoding with "caret" package

#joining data (population, sex)
```{r}
ohe_data <- data %>% 
  select(c("Population","Sex"))
```

```{r}
ohe_data_join <- PCA_data %>% 
  mutate(ohe_data$Population ,ohe_data$Sex)
```

#renaming columns
```{r}
ohe_data_join <- ohe_data_join %>% 
  rename( "Population" = "ohe_data$Population","Sex" = "ohe_data$Sex")

```

#Creatin dummies (caret package)
```{r}
#define one-hot encoding function
dummy <- dummyVars(" ~ .", data=ohe_data_join)

#perform one-hot encoding on data frame
final_df <- data.frame(predict(dummy, newdata=ohe_data_join))

#view final data frame
final_df

```

#PCA with one hot encoding
```{r}
pca_fit_ohe <- final_df %>% 
  prcomp(scale = TRUE)
```

#Eigenvalues
```{r}
pca_fit_ohe %>%
  tidy(matrix = "eigenvalues")
```

#Eigenvalues percentage plot
```{r}
pca_fit_ohe %>%
  tidy(matrix = "eigenvalues") %>%
  ggplot(aes(PC, percent)) +
  geom_col(fill = "#56B4E9", alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:9) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    labels = scales::percent_format(),
    expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.01))
  ) 
```
#Contribution of variable to PC
```{r}
var<-get_pca_var(pca_fit_ohe)
a<-fviz_contrib(pca_fit_ohe, "var", axes=1, xtickslab.rt=90) # default angle=45Â°
plot(a,main = "Variables percentage contribution of first Principal Components")
```
#PC1 VS PC2 Plot - Population
```{r}
pl1 <- pca_fit_ohe %>%
  augment(data) %>% # add original dataset back in
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, .fittedPC2, color = Population)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5)

pl2 <- pca_fit_ohe %>%
  augment(data) %>% # add original dataset back in
  ggplot(aes(.fittedPC1, .fittedPC2, color = Sex)) + 
  geom_point(size = 1.5)
  
show(pl1 / pl2)
```

##4. Clustering Principal Components
```{r}
#pca_fit_ohe<-prcomp(final_df, center=FALSE, scale.=FALSE, rank. = 4) # stats::
results <- pca_fit_ohe$x
fviz_nbclust(results, FUNcluster=kmeans, k.max = 16)  
km1<-eclust(results, "kmeans", hc_metric="eucliden",k=2)
fviz_silhouette(km1) 
```
